Description:
Detects creation of a new service via "sc" command or the powershell "new-service" cmdlet with suspicious binary paths

Author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Suspicious New Service Creation
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (((command like '%new-service%' and command like '%-binarypathname%') or (process_path like '%\sc.exe' and (command like '%create%' and command like '%binpath=%'))) and (command like '%powershell%' or command like '%mshta%' or command like '%wscript%' or command like '%cscript%' or command like '%svchost%' or command like '%dllhost%' or command like '%cmd %' or command like '%cmd.exe /c%' or command like '%cmd.exe /k%' or command like '%cmd.exe /r%' or command like '%rundll32%' or command like '%c:\users\public%' or command like '%\downloads\%' or command like '%\desktop\%' or command like '%\microsoft\windows\start menu\programs\startup\%' or command like '%c:\windows\temp\%' or command like '%\appdata\local\temp%'))
